metadata.title: CVE-2017-14151 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An off-by-one error was discovered in opj_tcd_code_block_enc_allocate_datain lib/openjp2/tcd.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0. The vulnerability causes anout-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service (heap-basedbuffer overflow affecting opj_mqc_flush in lib/openjp2/mqc.c andopj_t1_encode_cblk in lib/openjp2/t1.c) or possibly remote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14151` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
